17E5E50FBF864CF6BC6756207D40F88F.description: use representations to model and interpret physical, social, and mathematical phenomena

3972833250574CA3B8ADAA203BDC622F.description: select, apply, and translate among mathematical representations to solve problems

0272EFE5EC0B43219156EB92D601D9AA.description: create and use representations to organize, record, and communicate mathematical ideas

CAA1AE99211C4AE0B564536BCBD019B2.description: understand how mathematical ideas interconnect and build on one another to produce a coherent whole

6ECAA043454343268766ADE550C2DCDA.description: recognize and use connections among mathematical ideas

90CC7B02CBFF4717AD4CC31A73D9E08F.description: use the language of mathematics to express mathematical ideas precisely

3EF1D8805E7740D9AB9406D27796139F.description: analyze and evaluate the mathematical thinking and strategies of others

191948D340C24A1E90095FDAC1BA674D.description: communicate their mathematical thinking coherently and clearly to peers, teachers, and others

0440DFCE99764155AB0E21B4763B611F.description: organize and consolidate their mathematical thinking through communication

9DF4A98D826545868DDC2FBFA775F47D.description: develop and evaluate mathematical arguments and proofs

737099BE86494461B54C4925E28A0591.description: recognize reasoning and proof as fundamental aspects of mathematics

8E059BA6753E4AD6B8837E452434E6D7.description: build new mathematical knowledge through problem solving

A90393E59BAB424B8E1DB8F21DF9E64A.description: compute probabilities for simple compound events, using such methods as organized lists, tree diagrams, and area models

8033EB1363EC4CA8B9A30EAC59E8403D.description: understand and use appropriate terminology to describe complementary and mutually exclusive events

782135A052CB48BEA5B500571B91492E.description: Understand and apply basic concepts of probability

F74193D4F5BC47E5901F93FB8014EB43.description: use conjectures to formulate new questions and plan new studies to answer them

ACF7977A6C804C908D08A29A769EA040.description: make conjectures about possible relationships between two characteristics of a sample on the basis of scatterplots of the data and approximate lines of fit

FD98614F83D14FC6AA82255DAD2874A6.description: use observations about differences between two or more samples to make conjectures about the populations from which the samples were taken

B7E9E7BC3BA24605A689D65F3A5DD5D9.description: Develop and evaluate inferences and predictions that are based on data

2A6099F3440F4D43A287DD53A55AA91B.description: discuss and understand the correspondence between data sets and their graphical representations, especially histograms, stem-and-leaf plots, box plots, and scatterplots

E844CBE4591A47B093EF17E10752EB3C.description: find, use, and interpret measures of center and spread, including mean and interquartile range

C30E14DF8FE144728DD160F0444CD936.description: Select and use appropriate statistical methods to analyze data

1FA527210D9E454286C3AF088AB342CF.description: select, create, and use appropriate graphical representations of data, including histograms, box plot, and scatterplots

4923CF1671234431830719276A9AB734.description: formulate questions, design studies, and collect data about a characteristic shared by two populations or different characteristics within one population

3FA705CDBE7F4F8E825D18A34A3C3023.description: Formulate questions that can be addressed with data and collect, organize, and display relevant data to answer them

4009D62009174739A7812BCD55520C02.description: solve simple problems involving rates and derived measurements for such attributes as velocity and density

664FF64922DA4EA48D81C8513A9E4A21.description: solve problems involving scale factors, using ratio and proportion

362CDC70EEAC4AFB85A07A227BE68115.description: develop strategies to determine the surface area and volume of selected prisms, pyramids, and cylinders

2AA4C5C0011546089C591A8613003231.description: develop and use formulas to determine the circumference of circles and the area of triangles, parallelograms, trapezoids, and circles and develop strategies to find the area of more-complex shapes

37177F0D3A6B4EDF8FDEB32B805C2584.description: select and apply techniques and tools to accurately find length, area, volume, and angle measures to appropriate levels of precision

BB0C6B8A49774575A1AFC78728B71EB0.description: use common benchmarks to select appropriate methods for estimating measurements

49B114B39DB944C59E4A9D3941FD6CC6.description: Apply appropriate techniques, tools, and formulas to determine measurements

9E71E81FD30C4738AC517454E352EBCE.description: understand, select, and use units of appropriate size and type to measure angles, perimeter, area, surface area, and volume

7FA7DD9AC435413586DFB3A6295F5ADC.description: understand relationships among units and convert from one unit to another within the same system

045EFBA5C5C44210B3B9E710767E6023.description: understand both metric and customary systems of measurement

BD4817FBA11844F28FF32E04970D3260.description: Understand measurable attributes of objects and the units, systems, and processes of measurement

2FBE1D986B094A5B85D42BE57919D9D3.description: use geometric models to represent and explain numerical and algebraic relationships

5F203D288EC04EEDB4847333BEF5266A.description: use visual tools such as networks to represent and solve problems

ECF305D90F644F33AE218CD7A8A3BB81.description: Use visualization, spatial reasoning, and geometric modeling to solve problems

5EFCC1BF9DFE4BBB9A74EA724943446A.description: describe sizes, positions, and orientations of shapes under informal transformations such as flips, turns, slides, and scaling

873DDD612E0D463E84B0883817A15FB2.description: Apply transformations and use symmetry to analyze mathematical situations

A5D1B08F57BE4A02A46DB149A481D363.description: use coordinate geometry to examine special geometric shapes, such as regular polygons or those with pairs of parallel or perpendicular sides

576572A518E74DF9BD049C17A655689E.description: use coordinate geometry to represent and examine the properties of geometric shapes

48512B6F1829413BBFA3EEE0058F4B0E.description: Specify locations and describe spatial relationships using coordinate geometry and other representational systems

FF38FB12BB3B40CABF9DF0E968CCC676.description: create and critique inductive and deductive arguments concerning geometric ideas and relationships, such as congruence, similarity, and the Pythagorean relationship

0F3D74B525E9496FA3C9B2ED02036B32.description: understand relationships among the angles, side lengths, perimeters, areas, and volumes of similar objects

C52FDEC6FEF14A5781EEA8A2B0C13C05.description: precisely describe, classify, and understand relationships among types of two- and three-dimensional objects using their defining properties

5BA339E5B82E434E97F3A3A5E8208FE1.description: Analyze characteristics and properties of two- and three-dimensional geometric shapes and develop mathematical arguments about geometric relationships

AB7E3CAD0A474C22A73F31D0AC479A67.description: use graphs to analyze the nature of changes in quantities in linear relationships

5EAFA53BA1F64FCDA0F090E7490DE95D.description: model and solve contextual problems using various representations, such as graphs, tables, and equations

1877D377D1B447ACAD525F1BC54B1954.description: Use mathematical models to represent and understand quantitative relationships

7EE47EFBB9ED48C4AA01F4F4ADF9FEE7.description: recognize and generate equivalent forms for simple algebraic expressions and solve linear equations

25558D1E56E24F1CB569C58216505960.description: use symbolic algebra to represent situations and to solve problems, especially those that involve linear relationships

7C89097D85584EDD91BD1AB207C75C4C.description: explore relationships between symbolic expressions and graphs of lines, paying particular attention to the meaning of intercept and slope

CBD7D94508864B74A1691FAB3E701DFE.description: develop an initial conceptual understanding of different uses of variables

9FD39923CD284448B7BABFF1B82F3D2B.description: Represent and analyze mathematical situations and structures using algebraic symbols

FD9DEAA23258430391E658E77E1AD4E0.description: represent, analyze, and generalize a variety of patterns with tables, graphs, words, and, when possible, symbolic rules

FD3891E4AF3349F68CAE416ED98B5572.description: develop, analyze, and explain methods for solving problems involving proportions, such as scaling and finding equivalent ratios

72460D6AE53F4CE9A5944B367B788067.description: develop and use strategies to estimate the results of rational-number computations and judge the reasonableness of the results

A5C4901F682647408CC07F467117961B.description: develop and analyze algorithms for computing with fractions, decimals, and integers and develop fluency in their use
